1.speaker: SASAKO
1.japanese: どうしたの?パンダくん
1.english: What's wrong, Panda? I don't wanna go to work. It's the rainy season now, so there aren't many visitors.

2.speaker: PANDA
2.japanese: ヒマでヒマで超退屈なんだ
2.english: It's so boring and there's nothing to do. You're being dramatic.

3.japanese: どうせゴロゴロしてるだけでしょ
3.english: But all you do is lay around anyway.

4.speaker: PANDA
4.japanese: ヒマすぎるってつらいんだよ
4.english: It's hard to have nothing to do.

5.speaker: PANDA
5.japanese: それに僕は仕事でゴロゴロしてるの
5.english: Not to mention I'm lying around for work.

6.speaker: PANDA
6.japanese: ただのゴロゴロとは違うんだから
6.english: That's different from normal lying around.

7.speaker: PENGUIN
7.english: I have no idea what you're talking about.

8.speaker: POLAR BEAR
8.japanese: 僕もヒマになってゴロゴロしてみたいね
8.english: I want to try having nothing to do and lying around, too. There are times when I'm eating a snack slowly and only an hour's passed by.

9.speaker: PENGUIN
9.japanese: オヤツに１時間ってまるでセレブなマダムだね
9.english: An hour for a snack? You're like one of those rich, old ladies.

10.speaker: HANDA
10.japanese: コラ!何してるんですか

11.speaker: PANDA
11.japanese: だってお客さんいなくて ヒマなんだもん
11.english: There aren't any visitors, so we don't have anything to do.

12.speaker: HANDA
12.japanese: もう...ちゃぶ台なんか持ち込んで
12.english: You even brought in a small table.

13.speaker: FT PANDA
13.japanese: いやぁ気づかれないように 持ち込むのが大変で大変で
13.english: Yeah, it was so hard to bring it in without being noticed. You're not supposed to bring it in!

15.speaker: FT PANDA
15.japanese: 健康にいい熊笹茶でも一杯どう?
15.english: How about a cup of healthybear bamboo grass tea?

17.speaker: FT PANDA
17.japanese: 熊笹茶に含まれる笹多糖体には
17.english: The bamboo grass polysaccharides in this tea are said to have weight loss effects, too.

19.speaker: HANDA
19.japanese: いや最近メタボ気味でさ
19.english: Well, I have been putting on a little weight lately.

20.speaker: HANDA
20.japanese: さっさと片付けなさ～い!
20.english: Hurry and clean all of this up!

23.english: It's only 10 o'clock. What? It's only been 30 minutes?

24.speaker: PANDA
24.japanese: 夢の中では アイドル歌手としてＣＤデビューして
24.english: In my dream, I'd gotten my idol debut and released my first CD.

25.speaker: PANDA
25.japanese: 年末にはヤマアラシさんと年越しカウントダウンライブまでしたのに
25.english: And at the end of the year, I was even in the New Year's count down live with Yama Arashi.

26.speaker: FT PANDA
26.japanese: よくそんな都合のいい夢が見られるもんだね
26.english: It must be nice to be able to have such pleasing dreams.

27.speaker: FT PANDA
27.english: So who is Yama Arashi? You don't know that nationally famous idol group?

29.speaker: FT PANDA
29.english: That was depressing. Being told that something is common knowledge by Panda

30.japanese: 今なんかグサっときた

31.speaker: PANDA
31.japanese: 娘さんが２人もいるんでしょ?

33.speaker: FT PANDA
33.japanese: 最近あんまり会話がないしね
33.english: We haven't been talking much, lately. This is getting really depressing,

34.japanese: 注：「嘿!看那边」 日本儿童游戏。猜拳的赢家手指一个方向，输家不能把头转向那个方向。若方向一致，则赢家胜，若不一致，则重新猜拳。
34.english: so let's play "hey, look over there."

43.speaker: FT PANDA
43.japanese: もしかして私をバカにしてる?
43.english: Are you mocking me by any chance?

44.speaker: PANDA
44.english: I think I was sleeping wrong.

45.speaker: PANDA
45.japanese: 右にしか首が回らなくなっちゃったみたい
45.english: I can only turn my head to the right.

47.speaker: FT PANDA
47.japanese: 注：宇宙机兵，80年代Studio Pierrot制作的机械动画《宇宙奇兵》的neta。
47.english: A reprint edition model of theStar Gunner Bismar Ace.

48.english: Oh... Don't say "Oh." You sound like my wife.

49.speaker: FT PANDA
49.japanese: これはね プレミアもので

50.speaker: FT PANDA
50.japanese: ネットオークションで落札するのが大変だったんだから
50.english: and it was really hard to win it off the internet auction.

52.speaker: FT PANDA
52.english: Could you stop it with the "Oh"?

53.speaker: PANDA
53.japanese: 常勤パンダさんが モデラーなんて知らなかったよ
53.english: I didn't know you were into that kind of stuff, Mr. Full-time Panda.

54.speaker: FT PANDA
54.japanese: プラモは男のロマンだからね
54.english: Plastic models are a man's passion.

55.speaker: FT PANDA
55.japanese: ねぇ私のコレクション見たい?
55.english: Do you want to see my collection?

57.speaker: FT PANDA
57.japanese: 家にもたくさんあるんだけど
57.english: I have a lot more at home,

58.speaker: FT PANDA
58.japanese: 狭くなるからって家族に迷惑がられててさ
58.english: but my family complains that they're taking up too much room.

59.speaker: PANDA
59.japanese: 娘さんが２人もいるしね
59.english: Well, you do have two daughters. Well... Oh, what?

60.speaker: FT PANDA
60.japanese: 奥さんのお腹に３人目が...
60.english: My wife has a third in her tummy.

63.speaker: POLAR BEAR
63.japanese: はいしろくまカフェです
63.english: Hello, this is Polar Bear's Café.

64.speaker: PANDA
64.english: Hey, Polar Bear. I don't have anything to do, so let's play a word connecting game. I have things to do, though.

67.speaker: FT PANDA
67.japanese: はいふれあい動物園です
67.english: Hello, this is the petting zoo.

69.speaker: FT PANDA
69.japanese: そう言われましてもね...

70.speaker: FT PANDA
70.japanese: パンダだって 休みたいときがありますよ

71.speaker: HANDA
71.japanese: すみません! すぐ行かせますので...
71.english: I'm terribly sorry! I'll send them right over!

72.speaker: HANDA
72.japanese: ちゃんと仕事しなさい!

75.speaker: PANDA
75.japanese: 今日のお客さん第１号だからサービスしちゃおう
75.english: They're our first visitors today, so I'll give them extra service!

76.speaker: BOTH
76.japanese: サービスサービス!サービスサービス!
76.english: Service, service. Service, service. How cute!

77.speaker: GIRLS
77.japanese: パンダさんが けいれんしてる!

78.speaker: GIRL
78.japanese: 早く飼育員さんに知らせなきゃ!!
78.english: Hurry! We have to get the zoo keeper!

79.speaker: PANDA
79.english: This is depressing. How about we do the usual?

81.speaker: ALARM
81.japanese: 半田さん 急いでパンダコーナーに来てください
81.english: Mr. Handa, please hurry and come to the Panda Corner.

83.speaker: HANDA
83.japanese: 今度は何やってるんですか?

84.speaker: FT PANDA
84.japanese: 半田さんマージャンできる?
84.english: Do you know how to play mahjong, Mr. Handa?

86.speaker: PANDA
86.japanese: 大丈夫だよ 僕もルール知らないから
86.english: Oh, you'll be fine. I don't know the rules either.

87.speaker: PANDA
87.japanese: 雨も降ってて お客さんも少ないし
87.english: It's raining and there aren't that many visitors.

88.speaker: PANDA
88.japanese: 半田さんもどうせヒマでしょ?
88.english: You don't have anything to do, right, Mr. Handa?

89.speaker: HANDA
89.japanese: さっさと片づけなさい!
89.english: Hurry and clean all of this up!

90.speaker: SASAKO
90.japanese: ありがとうございました

91.speaker: PANDA
91.japanese: それでさヒマでヒマですごくつらかったんだ
91.english: And then, it was really rough because we had nothing to do. I can't empathize with you at all.

92.speaker: PANDA
92.japanese: 今日なんか同じ漫画を３０回も読み返したんだよ
92.english: I even read the same manga thirty times today.

93.speaker: PENGUIN
93.english: Could I get another café mocha?

94.speaker: PANDA
94.japanese: シロクマくんいいヒマつぶしの方法ってないかな?
94.english: Do you know any good ways to pass the time, Polar Bear?

97.speaker: PENGUIN
97.english: That would be dried bonito {\i1}(katsuobushi){\i0}. Oh, the moon...

98.speaker: PENGUIN
98.english: That would be the folk song "Tanko Bushi."

99.speaker: PANDA
99.japanese: シロクマくんって ヒマつぶしに困らなそうだよね
99.english: Polar Bear doesn't seem to have problems passing the time.

101.speaker: SASAKO
101.japanese: 私は目的を決めずに自転車で遠出するとかかな
101.english: I like to go on bike rides with no set destination.

102.speaker: SASAKO
102.japanese: あとは地図を眺めて風景を想像しながらの街歩き
102.english: I also like to wander around the citywith a map, admiring the sights.

104.speaker: MANDRILL
104.japanese: プチプチをひたすら潰します
104.english: I pop bubble wrap all the time.

105.speaker: TORTOISE
105.english: I read... really long... historical novels.

106.speaker: LLAMA
106.japanese: 黒ベタのジグソーパズルが難しすぎて時間を忘れられますよ
106.english: Solid black jigsaw puzzles are hard and can help you forget time.

107.speaker: KOALA
107.japanese: みんなうらやましいな

108.speaker: KOALA
108.japanese: 僕なんか１日２０時間は休まないとダメだから
108.english: I have to rest for twenty hours a day,

109.speaker: KOALA
109.japanese: 起きてる時間が足りなくて 困って困って...
109.english: so I never have enough time when I'm awake.

110.speaker: PENGUIN
110.japanese: 僕だって予定表がいっぱいで足りないよ。
110.english: My schedule is really full, too.

112.speaker: PENGUIN
112.japanese: ペン子さんって すごい働き者でね
112.english: Miss Penko is a really hard worker, and it's really hard to visit her everyday. So I don't have any time at all. And—

113.speaker: PANDA
113.japanese: シロクマくん笹をちょうだい
113.english: Could I get some bamboo grass, Polar Bear?

115.speaker: PENGUIN
115.japanese: それでさ ペン子さんがサービス券をね...
115.english: And then Miss Penko gave me service tickets...

116.speaker: PANDA
116.japanese: その話はもう何度も聞いたよ
116.english: We already heard that story too many times.

117.speaker: POLAR BEAR
117.japanese: まもなく当店は閉店いたします
117.english: Our store will be closing shortly.

119.speaker: POLAR BEAR
119.english: I wanted to try this at least once.

120.speaker: PANDA
120.english: It's already closing time... Time flies by so fast at Polar Bear's Café.

122.speaker: ALARM
122.japanese: 半田さん 至急パンダコーナーに来てください
122.english: Mr. Handa, please come to the Panda Corner immediately.

123.speaker: HANDA
123.english: What in the world is this?!

124.speaker: PANDA
124.english: Could I get my usual, Mr. Handa?

125.speaker: FT PANDA
125.japanese: 半田さんモーニングセット
125.english: Could I get the breakfast set, Mr. Handa?

126.speaker: LLAMA
126.japanese: チョコパフェください
126.english: Could I get a chocolate parfait?

128.speaker: KOALA
128.english: Could I get a cocoa, Mr. Handa?

129.speaker: HANDA
129.japanese: さっさと片づけなさい!
129.english: Hurry and clean all of this up!

130.speaker: HANDA
130.japanese: ここはカフェじゃありませ～ん!

132.speaker: SASAKO
132.english: I wonder if it's going to rain all day again today.

133.speaker: POLAR BEAR
133.english: I was able to write it. A kanji word I was able to read but not write.

135.speaker: SASAKO
135.japanese: シロクマさんさすがですね

136.speaker: SASAKO
136.japanese: ホント...雨続きで憂鬱ですよね
136.english: It is rather melancholy with all this rain.

137.speaker: HANDA
137.english: Jeez... I even gave him a cell phone so he wouldn't be late.

141.speaker: KIRINO
141.japanese: 先輩 あいかわらずモテますね

142.speaker: HANDA
142.japanese: 動物と子供とお年寄りにはモテるんだ
142.english: I'm popular with animals, kids, and old people.

143.speaker: HANDA
143.japanese: 女性にはさっぱりだけどな

144.speaker: FT PANDA
144.japanese: 彼はパンダ飼育員の半田さん
144.english: He is the zoo keeper in charge of pandas, Mr. Handa. He works hard everyday taking care of the pandas.

146.speaker: PANDA
146.japanese: 注：便当男：自己做饭的男子
146.english: He's a modern guy who makes his own lunch.

147.speaker: PANDA
147.japanese: ちなみに彼女いる歴０年
147.english: Number of years having a girlfriend: zero.

149.speaker: BOTH
149.english: Number of years having a girlfriend: zero.

150.speaker: HANDA
150.japanese: もう!ちゃんと お仕事してください!
150.english: Hey, would you get to work already?

151.speaker: HANDA
151.japanese: パンダくんは今日も遅刻だし...
151.english: Not to mention you were late again today, Panda.

152.speaker: HANDA
152.japanese: 何度もモーニングコールしたのに
152.english: I even called you repeatedly to wake you up.

153.speaker: PANDA
153.japanese: 半田さんていい人だよね
153.english: Mr. Handa, you're such a great guy. Huh?

154.speaker: PANDA
154.japanese: パンダのストラップもつけてくれるし
154.english: You even put on a panda strap. Well, you like pandas, Panda.

155.speaker: HANDA
155.japanese: じゃなくて ちゃんとお仕事しなさい
155.english: Or rather, hurry and get to work! But I'm worried sick about how you

156.japanese: 心配で心配で 仕事にならないんだよ
156.english: can't find a girlfriend that I can't work.

157.speaker: HANDA
157.english: Stop making excuses! But look over there.

158.speaker: PANDA
158.japanese: お客さんはカップルばかりだよ
158.english: All of our visitors today are couples.

160.speaker: PANDA
160.japanese: 相合傘でアツアツだよ

161.speaker: HANDA
161.japanese: 雨の日の動物園は穴場のデートスポットだからね
161.english: The zoo on a rainy day is a great, little-known dating spot.

162.speaker: FT PANDA
162.english: You sound like a dating expert,but you don't even have a girlfriend.

164.speaker: PANDA
164.japanese: デートの特集ばかり読んでないで
164.english: You should stop reading tips on dating and get to work.

165.speaker: HANDA
165.japanese: そんなの読んでないし

166.japanese: 仕事もさぼってないよ
166.english: And I'm not slacking off at work!

167.speaker: PANDA
167.english: If you had a girlfriend, you'd be more enthusiastic at work.

168.speaker: HANDA
168.english: Well, to me, all of you at the zoo are like my significant other.

169.speaker: FT PANDA
169.japanese: そんな清純派アイドルみたいなセリフは
169.english: Now you sound like a pure and innocent idol and I don't like it.

170.speaker: PANDA
170.japanese: そうだよ 私トイレに行きません
170.english: Yeah. I don't want to hear idol-like phrases like

171.japanese: なんて  アイドルみたいなセリフは聞きたくないよ

172.speaker: PANDA
172.japanese: ホントのアイドルは僕たちのように
172.english: True idols are like us and their poop smells like lemons.

173.speaker: FT PANDA
173.japanese: パンダくん話がそれてるよ
173.english: Your conversation is drifting, Panda. Not to mention, no matter how much you like animals, I think it'd be hard to be married to us animals.

174.speaker: HANDA
174.english: W-What are you even talking about?

176.speaker: PANDA
176.japanese: これからバツ２の常勤パンダさんが
176.english: Mr. Full-time Panda, who's been divorced twice,

177.japanese: 恋愛相談してくれるから
177.english: will now be your love advisor.

178.speaker: PANDA
178.japanese: ではお願いします先生
178.english: I leave it to you, advisor.

179.speaker: FT PANDA
179.japanese: 私バツ２じゃないんだけど

180.speaker: PANDA
180.english: Now I leave it to you, er... not advisor, but love hunter.

181.speaker: FT PANDA
181.japanese: 訂正するのはそこじゃないから
181.english: That wasn't the part you were supposed to retract. Or rather, could you not push weird characterizations on me?

182.speaker: HANDA
182.japanese: ともかく 恋愛相談なんていりません
182.english: Anyways, I don't need any advice on love.

183.speaker: PANDA
183.japanese: あんなこと言ってますよ 恋愛番長
183.english: That's what he says, love leader.

185.speaker: FT PANDA
185.english: But, Mr. Handa, would you be content with never having a girlfriend? N-Never? Yeah...

186.speaker: HANDA
186.japanese: 彼女がほしいのはもちろんなんだけど
186.english: Of course I want a girlfriend, but at my age, I'd rather have a wife than a girlfriend.

188.japanese: 半田さんいい人だから
188.english: You're a good person, Mr. Handa.

190.speaker: FT PANDA
190.japanese: そしていい人で終わっちゃうタイプだね
190.english: And you're the type that'll get nowhere as a good person.

191.speaker: PANDA
191.english: Yeah, someone no one cares about.

194.speaker: PANDA
194.japanese: 半田さんのよさをわかってくれる 女の子がきっといるよ
194.english: There must be a girl out there whowill understand what a great person you are.

197.speaker: PANDA
197.english: There has to be at least one somewhere in the universe.

200.speaker: FT PANDA
200.english: If you can meet the one person you're destined to be with,

201.speaker: FT PANDA
201.japanese: それだけで幸運でしょ
201.english: you don't need any more happiness than that. Mr. Full-time Panda. So, cheer up.

204.japanese: パンダに なぐさめられてていいんすか
204.english: Is it okay to let pandas cheer you up?

205.speaker: PENGUIN
205.japanese: パンダくん ほら もっと食べなよ
205.english: Here, eat more, Panda. I'm good, thanks. Then, here, Polar Bear.

209.speaker: PANDA
209.japanese: ペンギンさんの買ってくる パンの食べ過ぎで
209.english: I gained weight again from eating too many of the

211.speaker: PENGUIN
211.english: What are you talking about? Eat more.

213.speaker: PENGUIN
213.japanese: またペン子さんにサービス券をサービスしてもらっちゃったんだ!
213.english: Miss Penko gave me free service tickets again.

214.speaker: PENGUIN
214.japanese: これが握手券だったらもっと嬉しいんだけどな...
214.english: I'd be even happier if these tickets were for handshakes.

215.speaker: LLAMA
215.english: "Uhehe?" If you laugh so pervertedly, Miss Penko won't like you.

216.speaker: PENGUIN
216.japanese: 失礼な!!僕ウヒヒ... なんて笑い方してないよ!
216.english: How rude! I didn't laugh like "uhehe." Yeah, you totally didn't laugh like "uhehe."

220.speaker: KIRINO
220.japanese: 先輩この間のコンパの子たちが
220.english: By the way, the girls from our group blind date the other day

221.speaker: KIRINO
221.japanese: また半田さんと 飲みたいって言ってましたよ
221.english: said they want to drink with you again, Mr. Handa. Really?

222.speaker: KIRINO
222.japanese: またセッティングしましょうか?
222.english: Should I set something up again?

225.speaker: KIRINO
225.japanese: じゃあお先に失礼します

226.speaker: HANDA
226.english: Okay. Thanks for all of your hard work.

227.speaker: HANDA
227.japanese: 雨ちょっと強いから 気をつけてな
227.english: It's raining hard, so be careful.

228.speaker: KIRINO
228.japanese: はい先輩もほどほどにして 帰ってくださいね
228.english: I will. You should head home soon, too.

230.speaker: PANDA
230.japanese: 半田さんに借りたケータイ 忘れちゃった
230.english: I forgot the cell phone you lent me, Mr. Handa.

231.speaker: PANDA
231.japanese: 今しろくまカフェにいるから
231.english: I'm at Polar Bear's Café right now,

232.speaker: PANDA
232.japanese: 帰りに届けてくれない?
232.english: so could you drop it off on your way home?

233.speaker: HANDA
233.japanese: もう...パンダくんってば...

236.speaker: SASAKO
236.japanese: カッパお預かりします
236.english: I'll take your poncho for you.

239.speaker: HANDA
239.japanese: 今度から忘れないでよ
239.english: Don't forget it from now on.

241.speaker: PANDA
241.japanese: 半田さんって ホントいい人だよね
241.english: You're such a great guy, Mr. Handa.

242.speaker: HANDA
242.english: Jeez. Could I relax here for a little bit?

243.speaker: POLAR BEAR
243.english: Of course. And then, Miss Penko...

244.speaker: PANDA
244.japanese: それさっきも聞いたよ

245.speaker: LLAMA
245.japanese: 恋は動物の目を曇らせるんですかね
245.english: I wonder if love clouds the eyes of animals, too?

246.speaker: PENGUIN
246.japanese: いいじゃない聞いてよ
246.english: It wouldn't hurt for you to listen! Are you awake?

247.speaker: HANDA
247.japanese: すみません ついウトウトしちゃって
247.english: I'm sorry! I must have dozed off.

249.speaker: SASAKO
249.japanese: これ店長からのサービスです
249.english: This is on the house from the owner. It's so warm. The green of the plants is so vivid after the rain.

250.speaker: SASAKO
250.japanese: ホントきれいですよね

252.speaker: PANDA
252.japanese: ペンギンさんペンギンさん

253.speaker: PENGUIN
253.english: What is it, Panda? Tell me 500 cute things about me.

254.speaker: PENGUIN
254.japanese: ハードなお願いだなぁ

256.speaker: PENGUIN
256.japanese: 君妥協を知らないパンダだね
256.english: You don't understand how to compromise, do you?

258.speaker: PANDA
258.japanese: じゃあ僕の可愛いところを

260.speaker: POLAR BEAR
260.japanese: 次回のしろくまカフェは

261.speaker: POLAR BEAR
261.japanese: ご覧の放送局以外でお送りします
261.english: will be broadcasted on a station other than this one.

262.speaker: PENGUIN
262.japanese: ご覧の放送局で見れますよ
262.english: You'll be able to watch it on this station!
